data.title: It's red lobster
data.text: This location is what you expect from red lobster. The service was decent and the food was pretty good. Crab legs and lobster a bit overcooked and tough. The cheddar biscuits are the star of the show here.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Excellent service and delicious food. Our group ordered a variety of sea food dishes and we loved every dish and appetizer that we ordered.

data.title: Terrific!
data.text: Brian waited on us, could not have asked for better service!  Had the Atlantic salmon and it was delicious.  Enjoyed our visit here.  Great food, great service....thanks so much!!

data.title: Good seafood and great service
data.text: We have eaten here several times and have been very happy each time. It is busy at dinner time so you might have to wait. The menu has lots of choices at affordable prices. The clam chowder was very good. I tried the lobster pizza with pesto sauce and it was very good. We plan to return soon. Our server was outstanding.

data.title: Good fish choices
data.text: They have many different combo plates to choose from both grilled and fried/breaded.  They even have a steak combo plate.  The biscuits are to die for, but not great for those watching calories.

data.title: It's awesome . Great service
data.text:
First time in Denver and tried Red Lobster. 
Best decision to come here . Great service . Great food .will come back again. Keep it this way Red Lobster . 
To bad South Florida locations sucks on customer satisfaction .

data.title: Red Lobster Fan
data.text: Usually really enjoy Red Lobster. We couldn't tell if they were understaffed or just over-whelmed. Our server did not get our order correct. The quality of the food was good and consistant with Red Lobsters everywhere. Service was a little slow.

data.title: Great Service!
data.text: Wonderful meal for my friend and I. Karli was our waitress and she was fantastic from start to finish! Very professional and extremely efficient! Hadn't been to Red Lobster for quite some time but will definitely go back!

data.title: Red Lobster accommodated my soy allergy.
data.text:
I live in Maine, I was on vacation to Colorado.  There isn't a single Red Lobster Restaurant in our state.  I called the restaurant before I went.  I spoke with the Manager, Robert P. and he said that his kitchen would be able to accommodate my soy allergy.  Daniella was our server for the evening.  Robert came over a couple of times to check on us.  The kitchen staff prepared my entire meal from scratch without the use of soy oil or soy butter, but with real dairy butter.  They explained that to accommodate so many lactose folks, they had switched to soy.  They do keep the real butter on hand to accommodate soy allergies.

I found Danielle to be helpful, accommodating, and friendly.  She offered to have my biscuits made separately with butter instead of soy butter.  She went out of her way to make our meal enjoyable.  Robert was very engaging and helpful.  He returned to our table to be sure that our meals were what we had expected.  

Did I mention that we were seated under a painting of the Portland Head Lighthouse?  I saw a wide variety of Maine Lobster items on their menu.  I enjoyed my meal and would return. I would recommend this restaurant/location to others without question.

data.title: good value
data.text: my dinner companions had the $20 meal share - very good value and they said it was very good.  I had a salad and got there for happy hour - 2 for 1 draft beers.

data.title: Lobster fest
data.text: They changed the menu but enjoyed the selections offered. We really prefer to order several appetizers vs a heavy meal but could not resist the lobster linguine. Service was good and the wait was not too long.

data.title: Always a go to restaurant...
data.text:
My Husband and I went just last last week and he loves Lobsterfest.  He had the dualing lobster and I had a the two stuffed lobsters over potatoes combination.  The nice thing is that they easily let me change my sides, so I had the (really) fresh green beans and then asked the waiter to just put my baked potato on the side in a box so I could have it the next day for lunch.  All of the food was excellent as usual.  The service could have been just a touch more attentive, but he was not our usual waiter.  The only thing I could suggest, and this is for all of the Red Lobsters is not to clean, with a sweeper, where people are eating.  Especially if the rest of the restaurant is empty.
Otherwise, good, but I did miss our regular waiter.  Even though he didn't really pay attention my Husband paid over a 53% tip.  Just an FYI.
Yvonne Fitzpatrick

data.title: It's About Time
data.text: I've eaten at Red Lobster so many times I should probably buy stock in Darden Restaurants! I have bad experiences, good experiences and great experiences. The majority of my experiences at Red Lobster has been very good to say the least. I will say one thing, if I ever have a problem, the management will always make it right. The service is almost always good (just depends on the server) and the food options are always changing. Their mussels appetizer is a favorite and so is the Admirals Feast. If you like seafood, you usually can't go wrong with Red Lobster. After all, it IS where America goes for seafood!

data.title: Long time coming.
data.text: Haven't been to Red Lobster in a while.  I usually get the admirals feast but I am too old for all that fried food. Tried the shrimpfest. It was delicious. Our waiter Mike was great fun!

data.title: Monday treat
data.text: Kudos to hostess Madonna (for real ,call her Mandy just for fun) and waitress Ana. Cesar salad was adequate, i'm sure it would've been better with croutons but I avoid wheat. Blackened catfish with asparagus Yum, it needed a little more panache so I asked for Parmesan, which they happily brought. I'm getting used to the "I c white people" demog' in lakewood, Most clientele and staff here being no exception.

data.title: So So Ordinary
data.text: The service and the decor in the restaurant were the best part of my visit.  The food (other than the cheese rolls) was non-exceptional and rather pricey for what you receive.  No doggie bags as portions were small for the price.

data.title: I was hesitant
data.text: I usually don't eat at places like Red Lobster, Red Robin, Applebee's,  and so-on as the food can be just ho-hum. I was not excited about going here but this is where my parents picked for a thank you dinner. To my surprise the food was steaming hot, as were the biscuits,  and had great flavor. The inside of the restaurant was clean and not dark like some of the chains. The staff was AMAZINGLY nice and so accommodating.  I would recommend this restaurant if you are not the adventurous type as you can expect  and get good food at this location.

data.title: Excellent service
data.text: Finally got a chance to have trout and I wasn't disappointed.  It was excellent.  The garlic mashed potatoes and broccoli completed and complimented the meal.  The biscuits were hot and delicious----and while I shouldn't have eaten them, I did!!  Hard to resist.

data.title: Love the Lobster Special!
data.text: The Lobster special was really good and easily split between two people.  Nice crispy salads with lots of veggies.

data.title: Food had no flavor, quality & value is not what it used to be.
data.text: I took my family of four to Red Lobster for a celebration dinner.  We were both excited as we can not afford higher end dining as often as we'd like.  When we arrived we asked for a high chair and were told we could not have one at the table we were seated at.  (there was no physical limitation at the table) The food did not have much flavor, and what flavor it did have was not very good.  I was over charged for a beverage (which the server took care of.) but when my wife mentioned that she was unhappy with her meal it was as if nobody cared.  Needless to say- this has significantly decreased the likeliness that we will to return.
